subject: CHEM
name: Honors Chem I
info: Advanced introduction to atomic theory. Periodic properties of elements. Behavior of gases, liquids, and solids. Molecular/ionic structure, bonding. Aspects of organic chemistry, spectroscopy, and polymers. Energy sources, environmental issues. Mathematically demanding quantitative problems. Writing for scientific journals. Lecture, lab.

subject: CHEM
name: Honors Chem II
info: Advanced introduction. Chemical kinetics/reaction mechanisms, chemical/physical equilibria, acids/bases, entropy/second law of thermodynamics, electrochemistry/corrosion; descriptive chemistry of the elements; coordination chemistry; biochemistry; applications of chemical principles to environmental problems. Lab emphasizes writing for scientific journals.

subject: CHEM
name: Honors Chemistry I
info:
Advanced introduction to atomic theory. Periodic properties of elements. Behavior of gases, liquids, and solids. Molecular/ionic structure, bonding. Aspects of organic chemistry, spectroscopy, and polymers. Mathematically demanding quantitative problems. Writing for scientific journals.

Prereq: Honors student or permission of University Honors Program.
Math placement of MATH 1271 OR grade of at least C- in MATH 1151 or 1155

Concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 1065; registration for 1065 must precede registration for 1071H

subject: CHEM
name: Honors Chem II
info:
Advanced introduction. Chemical kinetics/reaction mechanisms, chemical/physical equilibria, acids/bases, entropy/second law of thermodynamics, electrochemistry/corrosion; descriptive chemistry of elements; coordination chemistry; biochemistry.

prereq: 1071H, concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 1076H, honors student, registration for 1076H must precede registration for 1072H

subject: CHEM
name: Honors Chemistry I Laboratory
info:
Develop laboratory skills while investigating physical and chemical phenomena closely linked to lecture material. Experimental design, data collection and treatment, discussion of errors, and the proper treatment of hazardous wastes. 

prereq: prereq or coreq 1071H; honors student or permission of University Honors Program

subject: CHEM
name: Honors Chem II Lab
info:
Develop laboratory skills as experiments become increasingly complex. Data collection/treatment, discussion of errors, proper treatment of hazardous wastes, experiment design.

prereq: concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 1072H

subject: CHEM
name: Honors Organic Lab
info:
Honors organic chemistry lab.

prereq: [2301 or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 2301], [Chem or ChemE or BioC major], instr consent

subject: CHEM
name: Honors Elem Org Chem I
info:
Important classes of organic compounds, their constitutions, configurations, conformations, reactions. Relationships between molecular structure/chemical properties/reactivities. Spectroscopic methods/characterization of organic molecules.

prereq: At least B+ in 1072H, UHP student

subject: CHEM
name: Honors Elem Org Chem II
info:
Continuation of 2331H. Reactions, synthesis, and spectroscopic characterization of organic compounds, organic polymers, and their role in biologically important classes of organic molecules such as lipids, carbohydrates, amino acids, peptides, proteins, and nucleic acids.

prereq: At least C- in 2331H, UHP student

subject: CHEM
name: Spec Topics in Chem
info:
Topics in chemistry. Opportunities, current research.

prereq: One sem 1xxx chemistry or instr consent

subject: CHEM
name: Spec Topics in Chem
info: Topics in chemistry. Opportunities, current research.

subject: CHEM
name: Dir Research
info: Learning experience in areas not covered by regular courses. Individually arranged with faculty member.

subject: CHEM
name: Honors Inorg Chem
info:
Periodic trends. Structure/bonding in compounds where s and p electrons are important. Descriptive chemistry of solids and transition metal compounds. Transition metal chemistry. Topics in main group and materials chemistry.

prereq: [2311 or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 2311], [4501 or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 4501 or 4502 or concurrent registration is required (or allowed) in 4502]
